handyrec.features package

Submodules

handyrec.features.group module

Definition of feature wrappers.

class handyrec.features.group.EmbdFeatureGroup(name: str, id_name: str, features: List[handyrec.features.type.Feature], feature_pool: handyrec.features.group.FeaturePool, value_dict: Dict[str, numpy.ndarray], embd_dim: int, l2_embd: float = 1e-06, pool_method: str = 'mean')

Bases: object

A wrapper that consturct concatenated embeddings of a group of features

name

Name of this EmbdFeatureGroup, should be unique.

Type

str

feature_pool

The FeaturePool instance that this FeatureGroup belongs to.

Type

FeaturePool

embd_dim

Output dimension of embedding, use a Dense layer to compress.

Type

int

id_name

Name of the id featrue, e.g. item_id, movie_id

Type

str

id_input

An input layer of the id feature.

Type

Input

embd_layers

Dictionary that stores embedding layer of sparse features.

Type

OrderedDict[str, CustomEmbedding]

embedding

Concatenated all feature values/embeddings of all ids.

Type

tf.Tensor

get_embd(index: tensorflow.python.keras.engine.input_layer.Input, compress: bool = True) → tensorflow.python.framework.ops.Tensor

Concatenate all features in this group and output a tensor that is ready for lookup.

Parameters

  • index (Input) – Lookup index.

  • compress (bool) – Whether compress the output into a size of self.embd_dim.

Note

The code will run successfully after replacing index with [], but there will be a

huge decrease in performance and converge speed, WHY? TO BE SOLVED

Returns

concatenated full feature value list of all ids, size: (id feature vocab_size, k)

Return type

tf.Tensor

lookup(index: tensorflow.python.keras.engine.input_layer.Input) → tensorflow.python.framework.ops.Tensor

Lookup all feature values by given id.

Parameters

index (Input) – Target ids.

Returns

Concatenated feature values of given ids.

Return type

tf.Tensor

class handyrec.features.group.FeatureGroup(name: str, features: List[handyrec.features.type.Feature], feature_pool: handyrec.features.group.FeaturePool, l2_embd: float = 1e-06)

Bases: object

A wrapper that consturct input, embedding, and concatenated output of a group of features

name

Name of this FeatureGroup, should be unique.

Type

str

features

List of features in this group.

Type

List[Feature]

feature_pool

The FeaturePool instance that this FeatureGroup belongs to.

Type

FeaturePool

input_layers

Dictionary that stores input layers of all features.

Type

OrderedDict[str, Input]

embd_layers

Dictionary that stores embedding layer of sparse features.

Type

OrderedDict[str, CustomEmbedding]

dense_output

List of input layers of dense features, to be concatenated

Type

List[Input]

sparse_output

List of embeddings corredsponding to the input index

Type

List

classmethod construct_embds(features: List[handyrec.features.type.Feature], feature_pool: handyrec.features.group.FeaturePool, l2_reg: float) → OrderedDict[str, handyrec.layers.tools.CustomEmbedding]

Construct embedding layers of sparse features

Parameters

  • features (List[Feature]) – List of features in this group.

  • feature_pool (FeaturePool) – The FeaturePool instance that this FeatureGroup belongs to.

  • l2_reg (float) – L2 regularization parameter for embeddings.

Returns

Dictionary of embedding layers, {name: embedding layer}.

Return type

OrderedDict[str, CustomEmbedding]

classmethod construct_inputs(features: List[handyrec.features.type.Feature], feature_pool: handyrec.features.group.FeaturePool) → OrderedDict[str, tensorflow.python.keras.engine.input_layer.Input]

Construct input layers pf each feature

Parameters

  • features (List[Feature]) – List of features in this group.

  • feature_pool (FeaturePool) – The FeaturePool instance that this FeatureGroup belongs to.

Returns

Dictionary of input layers, {name: input layer}

Return type

OrderedDict[str, Input]

embedding_lookup(pool_method: str = 'mean') → Tuple[List[tensorflow.python.keras.engine.input_layer.Input], List[tensorflow.python.framework.ops.Tensor]]

Concatenate all features in this group and output a tensor that is ready for model input.

Parameters

pool_method (str, optional) – Pooling method for SparseSeqFeature`s, by default `”mean”.

Returns

Output of all features in this group, (dense output list, sparse output list)

Return type

Tuple[List[Input], List[tf.Tensor]]

class handyrec.features.group.FeaturePool(pre_embd: Optional[Dict[str, Union[numpy.ndarray, tensorflow.python.framework.ops.Tensor]]] = None)

Bases: object

A container that stores input layers and embedding layers for groups of features.

input_layers

Dictionary of inpute layers shared by groups of features.

Type

OrderedDict[str, Input]

embd_layers

Dictionary of embedding layers shared by groups of features.

Type

OrderedDict[str, CustomEmbedding]

pre_embd

Dictionary of pretrained embeddings, {feature_name:embd}

Type

Dict[str, Union[np.ndarray, tf.Tensor]], optional

add_embd(embd_layer: handyrec.layers.tools.CustomEmbedding) → None

Add an shared embedding layer.

Parameters

embd_layer (CustomEmbedding) – An embedding layer.

add_input(input_layer: tensorflow.python.keras.engine.input_layer.Input) → None

Add an shared input layer.

Parameters

input_layer (Input) – An input layer.

init_embd(name: str, params: Dict) → handyrec.layers.tools.CustomEmbedding

Get an existed or construct a new shared embedding layer by name.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of layer.

  • params (Dict) – Input layer parameters.

Returns

Embedding layer named as feat_name.

Return type

CustomEmbedding

Raises

AttributeError – If layer attributes conflict with an existed embedding layer with the same name.

init_input(name: str, params: Dict) → tensorflow.python.keras.engine.input_layer.Input

Get an existed or construct a new shared input layer by name.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of layer.

  • params (Dict) – Input layer parameters.

Returns

Input layer named as feat_name.

Return type

Input

Raises

AttributeError – If layer attributes conflict with an existed input layer with the same name.

handyrec.features.type module

class handyrec.features.type.DenseFeature(name: str, dtype: str = 'int32')

Bases: handyrec.features.type.Feature

Dense Feature class

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of feature, each feature should have a distinct name.

  • dtype (str, optional) – Data type. Defaults to ‘int32’.

class handyrec.features.type.Feature(name: str, dtype: str)

Bases: object

Base class for different types of features

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of feature, each feature should have a distinct name.

  • dtype (str, optional) – Data type.

class handyrec.features.type.SparseFeature(name: str, vocab_size: int, embedding_dim: int, trainable: bool = True, dtype: str = 'int32')

Bases: handyrec.features.type.Feature

Sparse feature class

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of feature, each feature should have a distinct name.

  • vocab_size (int) – Vocabulary size.

  • embedding_dim (int) – Embedding dimension.

  • trainable (bool, optional) – Whether embedding is trainable or not. Defaults to True

  • dtype (str, optional) – Data type. Defaults to ‘int32’.

class handyrec.features.type.SparseSeqFeature(unit, name: str, seq_len: int)

Bases: handyrec.features.type.Feature

Sparse sequence feature, e.g. item_id sequence

Parameters

  • unit (Union[SparseFeature, FeatureGroup]) – sequence unit

  • name (str) – feature name

  • seq_len (int) – sequence length

handyrec.features.utils module

Contains feature-related utility functions.

handyrec.features.utils.split_features(features: Union[List[handyrec.features.type.DenseFeature], List[handyrec.features.type.SparseFeature], List[handyrec.features.type.SparseSeqFeature]]) → Tuple[OrderedDict[str, handyrec.features.type.DenseFeature], OrderedDict[str, handyrec.features.type.SparseFeature], OrderedDict[str, handyrec.features.type.SparseSeqFeature]]

Group a list of feature into three dictionaries by feature type.

Parameters

features (Union[List[DenseFeature], List[SparseFeature], List[SparseSeqFeature]]) – List of features.

Returns

Three dictionaries that contain different types of features.

Return type

Tuple[ OrderedDict[str, DenseFeature], OrderedDict[str, SparseFeature], OrderedDict[str, SparseSeqFeature], ]

class handyrec.features.SparseFeature(name: str, vocab_size: int, embedding_dim: int, trainable: bool = True, dtype: str = 'int32')

Bases: handyrec.features.type.Feature

Sparse feature class

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of feature, each feature should have a distinct name.

  • vocab_size (int) – Vocabulary size.

  • embedding_dim (int) – Embedding dimension.

  • trainable (bool, optional) – Whether embedding is trainable or not. Defaults to True

  • dtype (str, optional) – Data type. Defaults to ‘int32’.
